item.title: Capturing The Correct Element In Google Tag Manager
item.description: Google Tag Manager provides us with a bunch of handy triggers, designed to make capturing user interactions on the website much easier. These triggers are part of a paradigm called auto-event tracking, which comprises the Click, Form, History, and JavaScript Error trigger types. Now, I've covered GTM's triggers many, many times before. If you need a refresher, take a look at the following articles: Trigger Guide For Google Tag Manager Auto-Event Tracking In GTM 2.
